text: I have five children four daughters and
a son my son is the youngest the reason
I have five children is that we had four
daughters in a row we thought we were
done and we came out of retirement to
try once more for a little gender
balance in the troops and we got Gabriel
now Gabe is now 10 but when he was five
I gave a talk at Dartmouth my alma mater
to in the evening this was on health
promotion and it was a big Auditorium
filled with families including my own so
in the front row was my wife Catherine
my four daughters lined up on one side
of her and my then 5-year-old son Gabe
on the other side who did not want to be
sitting still at 7 in the evening
listening to his dad drone on so he was
very fidgety and basically driving my
wife crazy by uh fidgeting out of his
seat this got completely out of control
and I had to excuse myself and say uh
forgive me folks but my son is torturing
my wife I have to intervene and I had my
son get up basically and do a lap around
the auditorium to try and work out this
restlessness so he could sit still so he
did his lap came back sat down next to
his mother and then gave me this impish
in your- face dad you asked for it look
and took off again and did another lap
at the end of lap two he never bothered
to sit down he just waved and kept right
on going and three kids got up and took
off after him and when the four of them
came around nobody sat down they all
kept going and every kid in the audience
under the age of 12 got up and took off
after these guys so we now have 35 kids
running laps around the audience well to
make a long story short what I wound up
telling the audience was you know
actually this is much more important
than anything else I could be saying now
my son is healthy I assume your kids are
healthy he's a healthy 5-year-old boy
now Lord knows if you're cooped up with
him for any length of time you need to
medicate either him or yourself but
let's face it rambunctiousness in a
little boy is normal and
rambunctiousness should be treated with
recess not riddlin these kids are
telling us something so looking at that
that response that just that native
rambunctious response of my son I
thought we really should be able to find
a way to let kids get up and do exactly
this runaround for a minute when they
need to a program called ABC for Fitness
was born it stands for activity burst in
the classroom since that day five years
ago it has been refined by experts in
both physical activity and teaching and
it is now a detailed instructional
manual broken down by grade level and
subject matter that teaches Elementary
School teachers how to take kids through
brief bursts of physical activity
throughout the day anytime they need it
when the kids are restless not paying
attention apathetic instead of just
wasting that time saying sit sit still
keep your hands to yourself pay
attention take them through an activity
burst well we've implemented this in a
school district in the Midwest and
tested it there and we found significant
improvements in Fitness state aable
performance on standardized tests no
reduction in teaching time no increase
in disruptions in the classroom and a
significant reduction in medication use
for both asthma and ADHD you actually
can replace rlin with recess if you
break recess up so it fits into the
school day the schools have trouble
these days finding time for a block of
fizzed or a block of recess so ABC for
Fitness is a program developed by my lab
that is now in the public domain free to
the best of our knowledge we're in
hundreds if not thousands of schools
because the program works it's very easy
all the materials are readily available
and it costs nothing
